# Arpeggio: 6th in G#

An arpeggio is the sounding of the notes of a chord in sequence, one after another. In this case, we are looking at the 6th arpeggio in the key of G#. 

## Breakdown of Notes and Intervals
The G# major scale consists of the notes G#, A#, B#, C#, D#, E#, and F##. When building the arpeggio using the G# major scale and starting on the 6th note, E#, the notes of the arpeggio would be E#, G#, B#. This sequence comprises the 6th arpeggio in G#.

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The 6th arpeggio in G# has a bright and uplifting sound due to the major quality of the arpeggio. It can be used to add a touch of sophistication or sweetness to compositions. Arpeggios are commonly used in various genres, such as classical, jazz, pop, and rock, to create melodic interest, add texture, or highlight harmonic structures in the music.

## Songs
Here are three songs that incorporate the 6th arpeggio in G#:
1. **Eric Clapton - "Wonderful Tonight"**: The guitar intro features arpeggios that include the 6th arpeggio in G#, adding a romantic and melodic touch to the song.
   
2. **The Beatles - "Blackbird"**: This iconic song by The Beatles includes arpeggios incorporating the 6th arpeggio in G#, showcasing its versatility in a folk and pop context.

3. **Joe Satriani - "Always with Me, Always with You"**: This instrumental rock piece by Joe Satriani utilizes arpeggios extensively, including the 6th arpeggio in G#, to create a melodic and expressive guitar solo.

These songs demonstrate how the 6th arpeggio in G# can be used in various musical styles to enhance the harmonic and melodic elements of a composition.
